Posts.Content: Youwearpink wrote: I am posting the same message on a different strand. i thas been 24 hours and I was hoping tohear some story or words of advice to clear my head! Hello Ladies. I am almost a six year survivor. ( I am a tri-neg.  had one positive node, 6 rounds of chemo, mastec. and oopherectomy/hysterectomy. BRCA 1 AND 2 positve.) I am very nervous. I have been having pain in my right hip for about 4-6 months. I had a MRI of my hip and it came back stating there was a "suspicious" area about an inch in diameter.  I had a bone scan in Feb. that was clear.  But, the MRI showed this area.  My doc ordered a Pet Scan.  Does anyone have any similar stories that ended up being not cancer related.  So nervous. I am 32. I have a 9 year old and 5 year old. Ugh!!!!!  This sucks! Dx 6/23/2002, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIB, 1/9 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: HELP Youwearpink LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2008 01:01PM Youwearpink wrote: Hello Everyone, GOOD NEWS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My Pet Scan came back clear!!!!!!!  Still dont know why I am having the hip pain (really don't care...lol), but the pet scan didn't show the same result as the MRI. Still have some appts. but the pressure is off!!!! Thank you all for your support, prayers and kind words!!!!!  It means soooo much! Stacy
Posts.Title: HELP Youwearpink LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2008 05:43PM Youwearpink wrote: Luann, Thank you soooo much for that information! I needed to hear that!  I am so nervous! I get my results tomorrow from my PET Scan. When did you find out you had bone mets? What is your treatment regimen for them!  I wish you all the best and hugs (((((Luann)))))! I will add you into my prayers! Just so you know, this information is going to help me sleep tonight!  I hope your pain gets better. I will keep you posted! Stacy
Posts.Title: HELP Youwearpink LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2008 01:08PM Youwearpink wrote: Hip Hip Hooray,  I am so glad that you are doing well and have this great news.  Congrats! Stacy
Posts.Title: Yeessssss! chemo break!!! Analemma LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2008 08:19PM Youwearpink wrote: I am so sorry to hear this news. You will be in my prayers.Sometimes life is just not fair.......
Posts.Title: Please pray for my nephew britbaby wallan

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2009 08:02PM Youwearpink wrote: Waiting is the worst, worst, worst!  I always try to stay busy or call up my girlfriends to distract me!!!!  Ya think with todays technology they could speed things up for us!!!!  I was so bad with anxiety when I was first diagnosed, My oncolgist always scheduled an appt. with her immediately after a scan. She would call and try to get a preliminary reading! She is an Angel!!!  So I do relate with your tension and anxiety as you wait. I do promise it will get better as time passes! xoxoxoxoxoxox
Posts.Title: Had all of my scans...now the waiting game. pee AimeeFaye

Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 10:20PM Youwearpink wrote: LuAnn, It is soo not fair that you have to have Port problems on top of everything else. It is soooo justifiable to be be pissed and fed up. Plus, it musdt be hard to function with all of the pain you are having withyou back!  I think talking with you Onc. is a good idea. You don't deserve to be mistreated.  Best wishes and hugs to you. Hopefully thos obstacle is quickly behind you!!!!  (((((((((((((()))))))))))))) Stacy
